title: Ticket #6878: python2-condor RPM has wrong paths
description:
I installed the latest python2-condor RPMs on Fedora 29 and found a bunch of files in the wrong place (e.g. libraries in root). Here is the file list: 

% rpm -ql python2-condor
/classad.so
/htcondor.so
/usr/lib/.build-id
/usr/lib/.build-id/12/ddb966f997fb03879babdc6348d8c51cdfec60
/usr/lib/.build-id/ab/55fef85196a033ec29acf84a72e0db02ea1a65
/usr/lib/.build-id/af/37d7aa52b4a0571b288bd810f581b5f0ad92e3
/usr/lib64/libpyclassad2.7_8_6_11.so
remarks:
2019-Jan-24 06:29:46 by tim:
For Fedora RPMs, please fill out a bug report at bugzilla.redhat.com.

2019-Jan-24 10:48:52 by matyas:
OK. Can you check if this happens for any of the other platforms?

2019-Jan-24 10:51:41 by matyas:
Somebody already filed one: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1653257

2019-Jan-25 11:36:22 by tim:
I looked at HTCondor team builds and OSG builds and they look fine.
creator: matyas
